## joinDataTables() function

Join a new table to existing, using strict rules of id and prefix. I.e., this is not a general-purpose join util, but rather one that simplifies our joins by assuming an id column and a prefix for output columns.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function joinDataTables(left: ColumnTable, right: ColumnTable, type: string, leftKey?: string, rightKey?: string): ColumnTable;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  left | ColumnTable | left side of join |
|  right | ColumnTable | right side of join |
|  type | string | type of table (node, community, edge, join) |
|  leftKey | string | <i>(Optional)</i> optional explicit left key, otherwise it will use <code>${type}.id</code> |
|  rightKey | string | <i>(Optional)</i> optional explicit right key, otherwise it will use 'id' |

<b>Returns:</b>

ColumnTable
